intro: Platymiscium cochabambense, commonly known as the Cochabamba ironwood, is a small to medium-sized tree native to Bolivia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and sturdy, fibrous bark. The plant produces small, white flowers that are followed by elliptical, winged fruits. It is well adapted to dry and semi-arid environments, making it a valuable species for reforestation and soil stabilization. Its wood is hard and durable, historically used for construction and tool-making.
